WRITING.TEXT:
I know it's really stupid. But i got directed to a really cool song on soundcloud while listening to Steven Universe. I remember the title has "poison" in it but i am not sure. Many stated out that they had been directed there while listening to Aivi Surasshu too. Please help me find the song

WRITING.TITLE: How hard is it for another network to pick up Steven Universe in the unlikely event of the show being canceled before the story concluded ?
WRITING.TEXT: Do they have to buy the whole show including the old seasons too ? I am content with the current story, but sometimes wish it had more creative freedom so writers can have fun with characters, build tension and emotion more effectively.

he retired

the cloud is moving

I think you're misunderstanding my point. Death penalty is a good thing, i know, i deserve it. But stripping my character and break immersion is not the best way to go. Imagine a system where your client is turned off everytime you die, you go and complain on reddit and someone tell you "stop crying and stop asking everything to be a walk in the park"
I am looking for advice from locals, and i am not saying "no German" either, just that every advice seem to be pointing to the same country
yea but having you stripped isn't the greatest idea for death penalty imo.
I am not against armour repair in general. They are there for death penalty and building a little bit of immersive gameplay. But ironically they can sometimes destroy said immersion xD.
I tend to use them very quickly, so didn't have any to bring with me
My ele got her ass beaten into submission by the boss. I really am not good at this game

WRITING.TITLE: I had to honor Eir in my bikini
WRITING.TEXT: During my story playthrough, i died so much fighting the last boss my armour broke. So it was either ignore it or leave the instance to repair, which would take 30 minutes to replay the story. I know i sound like a spoiled child at this point, but can you make armour unbreakable during story instance ?
As in additional information, doesn't mean "hey Germany only"
Please don't jinx it
Is there anywhere else i can go beside Germany ? lol
Thank you

WRITING.TITLE: Studying abroad for Asian student, where should i go in Europe if i want to self-sustain ?
WRITING.TEXT:
I am looking to get a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science studying aboard, but unfortunately, just this year many countries introduce tuition fee for non-EU students, and i am broke. Can you guys suggest a study program that can enable me to afford my stay and studying? I don't mind shitty living conditions, ( ie cutting down to 2 meals a day, working 2 jobs.. etc )
Ps: asked this in /r/studyAbroad but there doesn't seem to be any active member there, so i brought the post here
Edit: i know a bit of German too if the information is of any help
